channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for DE

item.title: Report X-2023050424
item.description:
Report X-2023050424

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-28
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package was found in the bottom of the trailer wet and with an odor. a package handler then got qa to get the package, upon inspection of the box found that one can of 2 cycle gasoline mix had a loose and cracked cap on it. then the area was wiped clean DescribePack: the cap was loose and when tightened and hold upside down product was leaking from a crack on the cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box was placed in a tote

item.title: Report E-2023020541
item.description:
Report E-2023020541

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-07
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XSA experienced a UN3066 "SeaShield 550 Epoxy Grout" release from (2) 3-gallon metal pails to the trailer floor due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractor to assist with cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 1' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pails, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023020217
item.description:
Report E-2023020217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-30T21:08:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-10
  • City: Dover
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Eagle Transport Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver made a wide right turn onto an access road behind the store to make delivery. As he did so, his trailer was struck by a passenger vehicle. The trailer’s #5 discharge head and fitting box were damaged. The discharge head damage resulted in the loss of approx. 14 gals of RUL onto the paved surface of the access road. There was no impact to the soil or water, but Dover FD personnel dispersed oil-dry to contain the released product. Product came from the wet lines only. The vessel was not compromised.

item.title: Report E-2023010334
item.description:
Report E-2023010334

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-20
  • City: NEW CASTLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KENAN TRANSPORT LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Kenan Transport, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank when the hose adaptor broke. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. The customer had an environmental contractor respond and handle the remediation.
